title: Casual Friday Doesn’t Have to Be Boring, and These 10 Work Looks Prove It
description: Welcome to the crossroads of style and comfort.
excerpt: Welcome to the crossroads of style and comfort.
text: If you have a pulse and a job in an office, I’m talking to you. Is it just me, or does getting dressed in the morning feel particularly dreadful? My mornings usually involve multiple outfit changes and a temper tantrum. Why is it so hard to come up with casual work outfits? Uncomplicated. Quick. Comfortable. Not boring, but subtle. And because an understated outfit always always requires a little extra oopmh, tantrum by tantrum, I’ve learned how to layer, when to use color, which pieces to accessorize with, and how to translate trends for the workplace. I’m painting with a wide brush to accommodate a broad spectrum of jobs and office cultures. With that said, take each of these 10 tasteful outfit ideas and tailor them to your own circumstances. Scroll on to shop my go-to wardrobe heroes. Find a Matching SetEdward BerthelotNothing is less complicated than throwing on a coordinating top and bottom and running out the door. Opt for trouser shorts, a funky loafer, and a trendy necktie around a crisp button-up.R13 Drop Neck ShirtFree People Prep Striped TieStaud Luisa Long Shorts Now 55% OffEterne Lounge SockVagabond Eida LoaferClare V Claude TotePlay with TexturesEdward BerthelotIf you’re like me, most of what you wear is black. So, to avoid monotony, try mixing up the textures of your pieces, like pairing a wool coat with a leather skirt and ribbed top. It gives your look depth!Mango Handmade Oversized Wool Coat Now 35% OffVeronica Beard Pruitt Ribbed Tee Lafayette 148 New York A-Line Leather Midi SkirtBanana Republic Brushed Wool-Cashmere Triangle ScarfNow 28% OffMaeden Market ToteNow 30% OffStaud Alba Flat Put It In NeutralJeremy MoellerI frequent the greys, taupes, creams, and occasionally, navys. I’ve become a veteran at knowing how to stack these hues, and I think this a perfect example. Personally, I would opt for a slouchier bag and a flat pair of shoes to dress it down a tad. html:
If you have a pulse and a job in an office, I’m talking to you. Is it just me, or does getting dressed in the morning feel particularly dreadful? My mornings usually involve multiple outfit changes and a temper tantrum. Why is it so hard to come up with casual work outfits?

Uncomplicated. Quick. Comfortable. Not boring, but subtle. And because an understated outfit always always requires a little extra oopmh, tantrum by tantrum, I’ve learned how to layer, when to use color, which pieces to accessorize with, and how to translate trends for the workplace. I’m painting with a wide brush to accommodate a broad spectrum of jobs and office cultures. With that said, take each of these 10 tasteful outfit ideas and tailor them to your own circumstances. Scroll on to shop my go-to wardrobe heroes.

Find a Matching Set

Nothing is less complicated than throwing on a coordinating top and bottom and running out the door. Finding a really good set, like this one, is perfect on days when you don’t have the time or energy to try everything you own on.

AEXAE Linen Woven Shirt

AEXAE Linen Highrise Trousers

Little Liffner Sprout Tote Bag

Aeyde Zoe Leather Ankle Boots

Illesteva Munich Sunglasses

Sophie Buhai Fan Shell Acetate Hair Clip

Tie It All Together

Put a modern twist on a classic office look. Opt for trouser shorts, a funky loafer, and a trendy necktie around a crisp button-up.

R13 Drop Neck Shirt

Free People Prep Striped Tie

Staud Luisa Long Shorts

Now 55% Off

Eterne Lounge Sock

Vagabond Eida Loafer

Clare V Claude Tote

Play with Textures

If you’re like me, most of what you wear is black. So, to avoid monotony, try mixing up the textures of your pieces, like pairing a wool coat with a leather skirt and ribbed top. It gives your look depth!

Mango Handmade Oversized Wool Coat

Now 35% Off

Veronica Beard Pruitt Ribbed Tee

Lafayette 148 New York A-Line Leather Midi Skirt

Banana Republic Brushed Wool-Cashmere Triangle Scarf

Now 28% Off

Maeden Market Tote

Now 30% Off

Staud Alba Flat

Put It In Neutral

I frequent the greys, taupes, creams, and occasionally, navys. I’ve become a veteran at knowing how to stack these hues, and I think this a perfect example. Personally, I would opt for a slouchier bag and a flat pair of shoes to dress it down a tad.

Max Mara Single-Breasted Water-Repellent Twill Trench Coat

COS Boxy Long-Sleeved Polo Shirt

AGOLDE Low Slung Baggy Wide-Leg Jeans

The Row Bindle Suede Tote Bag

Gucci Slim Rectangular

Veronica Beard Penny Leather Mule

Lean Into Transitional Pieces

As we slowly slip into spring, don’t be afraid to start incorporating next season’s pieces into your daily attire. Wear your favorite winter sweater with a rain coat, or layer up with warm pieces in pastel hues. This trench coat from J. Crew, for example, is a great transitional piece.

J.Crew Rain-or-Shine Trench

Nili Lotan Coras Sweater

Now 50% Off

Icon Denim Rose Eco Jeans

Nomasei Gris Chiné Socks

Adidas SL 72 OG Sneaker

By Far Off-White Bea Creased Leather Bag

Now 60% Off

Dress It Down

This is your chance to wear a sweatshirt at work—why would you squander that? Throw a blazer over a plain hoodie, cover that bed head with an elevated baseball hat, and relish in this near-pajama day.

Ducie Corrin Suede Trench Coat

Jacquemus Les Classiques Hoodie

Now 60% Off

Reiss Wide Leg Elasticated Trousers

American Needle Big City Ball Cap

Jeffrey Campbell No-Space Boots

Now 35% Off

Sandro Suede Tote Bag

Layer with a Stylish Coat

Just like in art, the best outfits have one strong focal point. In this case, a chic coat is all you need. Paired with dark jeans and a tee peeking underneath, you’re good to go.

Toteme Country Coated Cotton Coat

St. Agni Woven Large Tote

Eterne Soft Jersey Fitted Turtleneck Top

Mother Denim The Hustler Roller Sneak

Lizzie Fortunado Studded Silver Mini Arp Earrings

The Row Nobilis Leather Ankle Boots

Add a Pop of Color

Yellows! Pinks! Blues! Spring is here, so it’s time to start adding color back into your wardrobe. I would recommend a bright cherry red or butter yellow this season. When in doubt, try pastels.

Proenza Schouler Sakia Coat

Maje Shirt with Removable Tie

AG Jeans Adria Jeans

Tory Burch Romy Pebble Leather Bucket Bag

Vaincourt Le Désirable Belt

Salomon Acs + OG Unisex Sneaker

Opt for Comfortable Basics

The perfect white tee (and yes, I have a specific one in mind), a pair of oversized trousers, and a soft sweater is all you really need. This is my go-to look when I’ve hit snooze one too many times and am running more than fashionably late to the office.

& Other Stories Collared Knit Cardigan

Leset Yoko Pocket Pant

Cou Cou Intimates The Baby Tee

Lu Goldie Jordyn Sunglasses

Mango Mesh Ballet Flats

Dragon Diffusion Big Santa Croce Leather Tote Bag

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
